result.execSummary:
Jeremiah Kortez Boyd was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Jeremiah Kortez Boyd was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremiah Kortez Boyd in court in custody with attorney Michael J. Fitzsimmons.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Jeremiah Kortez Boyd in court in custody with attorney Michael J Fitzsimmons.  Mark M Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant on a PO Hold on 13CF1841  Status conference scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jeremiah Kortez Boyd in court with attorney Michael J Fitzsimmons.  Richard J Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights advised, Defendant waives extradition freely & voluntarily. Court accepts waiver & signs order.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremiah Kortez Boyd in court in custody by video conference with attorney Michael J Fitzsimmons.  Mary E Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed; Copy to Deft; Penalties advised; Rights given; Reading waived. $1000 Cash bond set.

Defendant Jeremiah Kortez Boyd in court in custody with attorney Valerie A Zisman.  Mason C Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed; Copy to Deft; Penalties advised; Rights given; Reading waived. Atty. Fitzsimmons appointed. Bond to be set,  Initial appearance scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
